column4: Hi. Can somebody tell how can I disable graphical logins to gnome at all? I don't want to remove gnome.
I removed /etc/init.d/gdm and /usr/sbin/gdm, but I am still able to login.
apt-get remove gdm
but this will remove gnome at all, right?
no, just gdm, the display manager
it will also remove the ubuntu-desktop metapackage
but ubuntu-desktop is just an empty package with nothing but dependencies
yes, apt-get install gdm will get you the graphic login back
is gdm a lot of packages or just one. I want to download just in case.
one
you mean the failsafe entry in grub?
i dont know. i use neither gdm nor kdm (and no gnome, no kde)
i prefer text login and then startx. my desktop is xfce.
This box is used by non-professionals. They understand only GUI logins
then why do you want to disable gdm?
okay. sorry, cannot help you with kdm. however there should be a kdmrc somewhere in /etc/kde/...
my apt is telling me it has to remove 2 packages?
gdm and ubuntu-desktop i guess
I am going to delete gnome manually. I made apt-get remove gdm, but I can login to ubuntu without any problem?
you said you wanted kdm, so apt-get install kdm. or do you want to use kde instead of gnome?
yes to what?
but you still want gnome as desktop, dont you?
nope
